title: Remarks

definitions.Reinforcement learning: an AI area concerned with how an intelligent agent ought to take actions in a dynamic environment in order to maximize the cumulative reward.
definitions.Supervised learning: not needing labelled input/output pairs to be presented, reinforcement learning focuses on finding a balance between exploration (of uncharted territory) and exploitation (of current knowledge) with the goal of maximizing the long term reward.

summary: The slide discusses reinforcement learning, a subset of machine learning, which differs from supervised learning by not requiring labeled input/output pairs. It emphasizes the balance between exploration and exploitation to maximize long-term rewards. Visual examples of unsupervised, supervised, and reinforcement learning are provided.
